bill_title: to limit the contributions of political parties to certain candidates.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the contributions of political parties to certain candidates. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 12-25 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No political party may contribute more than five thousand dollars in any election cycle to a candidate for state office and to any candidate's committee established to secure the nomination or election of the candidate for state office. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That chapter 12-25 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No political party may contribute more than five hundred dollars in any election cycle to a candidate for legislative office and to any candidate's committee established to secure the nomination or election of the candidate for legislative office. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 3. That § 12-25-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SUBDIVISION to read as follows: "Election cycle," the period from January first following a general election for a public office to December thirty-first following the next general election for that office.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
